About us

What is the Turing Award

"The A.M. Turing Award, sometimes referred to as the "Nobel Prize of Computing," was named in honor of Alan Mathison Turing (1912–1954), a British mathematician and computer scientist. He made fundamental advances in computer architecture, algorithms, formalization of computing, and artificial intelligence. Turing was also instrumental in British code-breaking work during World War II." (source)

55 years of awards.
76 recipients.
1 000 000 US$ prize (sponsored by Google).
